snippet: In a new book, William J. Baumol offers an explanation for why some costs rise faster than others — and how we can still afford labor-intensive services in the future.
abstract: Amy Wallace Off the Shelf column reviews book The Cost Disease: Why Computers Get Cheaper and Health Care Doesn't by William J Baumol.
lead_paragraph: In a new book, William J. Baumol offers an explanation for why some costs rise faster than others — and how we can still afford labor-intensive services in the future.

headline.seo: ‘Cost Disease’ Offers a Case for Health Care Calm
headline.main: The Case for Calm Over Rising Health Costs
headline.print_headline: The Case for Calm Over Rising Health Costs
